719750f-c.title: Manhattan: Foley Square - Pearl Street
719750f-c.text:
Foley Square, easterlv side, north from Duane, acroas Pearl,
to Worth Streets, showing respectively, The Federal Courts Bldg.,
the New York County Court House and the New York State Bldg. all
faciug on what technically is Centre Street.
Views 2 and 3 emphasire the New York County Court House and
are viewed eastward from Elm Street (the westerly boundary of the
square) which in its self is really a continuation of Lafayette
Street.
All of these structures are built upon and around what in early
days was Collect Pond and vhere in 1798, John Fitch tried his new
steamboat under the ohservation of Chancellor Livingston and other
prominent New Yorkers. Where Centre and Leonard Streets intersect
today it had a depth of 60 feet. Durinm the Enmlish and French
conflict, President Jefferson (1807) ordered an embargo on all
shippina and New York suffered. To alleviate same, individuals
were set to vork to fill in this pond and morass and thereby set
a precedent for public ork relief. A drainage canal was cut thru
in 1809 which later became Canal Street.
Propositions for the use of the area as a Park were introduced
as early as 1789, though naught came of them and it remained a dreary
vacant area awaiting modern scientific enmineering. Their main
difficulty Aas not vater but quicksand and most of these buildings
have whhat is called a floating foundation.
June 12, 1938.
Views 1,2 and 3
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
719750f-c.folder: Foley Square & Pearl Street, Manhattan, NY

719748f-b.title: Manhattan: Foley Square - Pearl Street
719748f-b.text:
(1)
The New York County Court Building, fronting on Foley Square, south
from but not including Worth to, and including Pearl Streets.
October 22, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)  The same, from a different angle, showing site for the new Federal
49ourts Building in the foreground.
March 14, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUOTIONS.
(3)
The Court House in its final stages of construction.
May 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(4)
The same as No. 1. Note the old Board of Health Building still standing
on the right.
October 7, 1930.
Eumene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
719748f-b.folder: Foley Square & Pearl Street, Manhattan, NY

719741f-a.title: Manhattan: Foley Square - Duane Street
719741f-a.text:
Foley Square, north from Duane Street, showing the east side of Centre
Street (right) and the west side of Lafayette Street (left). Buildings of
ipgortance seen are, the Tombs, N.Y. State Building and the N.Y. County Court
Pouse.
March 14, 1932.

719743f-d.title: Manhattan: Foley Square - Pearl Street
719743f-d.text:
Foley Square, east side, between Pearl and Worth Streets, showing
the New York County Court House under construction. This set of 4 views
shows the Pearl and Baxter Street sides. The fenced area in the foreground
is the south side of Worth Street, east of Centre Street. On the right
appears the old Board of Health Building. The entrance will be.through
the unfinished frame work shown on the right. Centre Street at this
point forms the east side of Foley Square.
July 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

of a 4-story house and a 2-story adjunct bearing No. 2O City Hall Place,
at and adjoining the N.E. corner of Duane Street.
February 24, 1929.

718562f-a.text:
Centre Street, east side, north from Pearl Street. Buildings shown
across the background, are on the north side of Leonard Street, east from
Centre to Baxter Streets. The 1-story building in the foreground, is used
by the Child Welfare Board, and is on the north side of Worth Street, east
of Centre Street. Eventually this will form the site of the N.Y. State
6ffice Building.
September 24, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPPODUCTIONS.

appears the old Board of Health Building.

719750f-b.title: Manhattan: Foley Square - Pearl Street
719750f-b.text:
Foley Square, easterlv side, north from Duane, acroas Pearl,
to Worth Streets, showing respectively, The Federal Courts Bldg.,
the New York County Court House and the New York State Bldg. all
faciug on what technically is Centre Street.
Views 2 and 3 emphasire the New York County Court House and
are viewed eastward from Elm Street (the westerly boundary of the
square) which in its self is really a continuation of Lafayette
Street.
All of these structures are built upon and around what in early
days was Collect Pond and vhere in 1798, John Fitch tried his new
steamboat under the ohservation of Chancellor Livingston and other
prominent New Yorkers. Where Centre and Leonard Streets intersect
today it had a depth of 60 feet. Durinm the Enmlish and French
conflict, President Jefferson (1807) ordered an embargo on all
shippina and New York suffered. To alleviate same, individuals
were set to vork to fill in this pond and morass and thereby set
a precedent for public ork relief. A drainage canal was cut thru
in 1809 which later became Canal Street.
Propositions for the use of the area as a Park were introduced
as early as 1789, though naught came of them and it remained a dreary
vacant area awaiting modern scientific enmineering. Their main
difficulty Aas not vater but quicksand and most of these buildings
have whhat is called a floating foundation.
June 12, 1938.
Views 1,2 and 3
P. L. Sperr
